medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain attributed to gallstones.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began since the afternoon prior to presentation. The patient experienced an episode of RUQ pain attributed to gallstones eight months ago. He was seen in the emergency department overnight where pain improved by morning, but it persisted at home along with a low grade fever of 100.1Â°F which led to his return to the emergency department for evaluation. Denies nausea, emesis, chest pain, and shortness of breath.
